1479091672806006786.text: 700+ rioters have been arrested & 160+ have pleaded guilty. And while justice is delivered to those who broke the law, @January6thCmte has been working around the clock to determine exactly what led to the attack & uncover every detail of the security failures that followed.

1479091671296004098.text: These attempts to whitewash the insurrection are extremely dangerous. Bad actors have continued to gin up more hate, making the January 6th attacks feel like just an appetizer of more to come. We have an obligation to prevent that from happening.

1479091669115015171.text: I’m angry that 5 officers died from the day's trauma, with hundreds injured. I’m mad that my colleagues — knowingly pushing a lie that led to the violence — still voted to overturn the election results. And I’m furious that many of them downplay the damage for political benefit.

1479091667726704647.text: But I’ll be honest — I’m still extremely angry about what happened on #January6.

1479091665231138818.text: One year later, I'm deeply grateful for the courageous actions of the @CapitolPolice, city, state and federal law enforcement officials & the National Guard who defended the Capitol Building and ensured that we could return safely to the House Floor to certify the election.

1479091663100338177.text: It feels like just yesterday that we were barricaded in my office as a violent mob attacked the Capitol, beat police officers, broke windows & doors, and held the seat of our Democracy hostage — all in an attempt to overturn the 2020 election & the will of the American people. https://t.co/clh0EuO5kY

1473311336608194562.text: Despite efforts from some service providers and other nations to take the site down or restrict access, Sanctioned Suicide continues to reemerge with new domain names and remains easily accessible via a simple Google search. We share a bipartisan commitment to changing that.

1473311335047999492.text: Owners of the website try to limit legal liability by encouraging anonymity, requiring users to be over 18 years old, and deleting accounts of users after they have posted ‘goodbye’ threads. But @nytimes identified at least three victims under 18. https://t.co/qRcZkSk1vT

1473311333747732487.text: In addition to discussing ways to die by suicide, anonymous users routinely encourage each other to attempt to take their own lives, offering praise for those who follow through. Sanctioned Suicide has 6 million views per month and nearly half of all users are under 25 years old.

1473311332275564545.text: A @nytimes investigative report found that only 5 percent of posts on Sanctioned Suicide are focused on recovery. More than half of the top 100 posts on the site include instructions or discussions of methods to die by suicide. 28 of those posts narrate suicide attempts.

1473311330887249922.text: Warning: Before reading further, this thread describes the threats posed by Sanctioned Suicide in detail and can be distressing. If you or someone you know are having thoughts of suicide, please contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 800-273-8255 (TALK).

1473311328802594816.text: Sanctioned Suicide publishes "explicit directions on how to die.” Anonymous users share suicide plans, promote poisons, post 'goodbye threads' and share real-time suicide attempts. I'm leading a bipartisan group of lawmakers working to address the dangers this site poses. 🧵 https://t.co/8w1Wcz1fkh

✔️ Record job creation
✔️ Low unemployment 
✔️ Higher wages
✔️ Lower costs

The bipartisan #InfrastructureBill & #BuildBackBetter Act will deliver for working families and make our economy even stronger!

1461707477641216007.text: The #BuildBackBetter Act means no one will be left behind as we defeat COVID-19 and rebuild our economy — because when working families win, America wins.

1461707476408152065.text: And by cutting taxes for low-income & middle-class Americans and extending the monthly #ChildTaxCredit payments that have served as a lifeline for so many, it’ll keep money in families’ pockets.

1461707474768211975.text: By lowering health care costs & driving down prescription drug prices, it will make sure families no longer have to choose between their health & their ability to put food on the table.

1461707472398397440.text: By expanding access to quality child care, providing paid family and medical leave, establishing universal Pre-K & making home care for our seniors affordable, it will propel parents – particularly working moms – back into the workforce.

1461707470666141696.text: We just passed the #BuildBackBetter Act! Together with the historic bipartisan #InfrastructureBill signed into law by @POTUS this week, working families like the one I grew up in have the chance to succeed in an economy that finally works for them. 🧵

1461670304325984257.text: Today, we’re going to pass the #BuildBackBetter Act! This legislation makes historic investments that ensure parents can return to work, kids can succeed in school and working families can finally get ahead.

1372294084816207873.text: To get more shots into more arms, the #AmericanRescuePlan provides more than $20 billion to establish a National COVID-19 Vaccination program and improve the administration and distribution of vaccines, including allocating funds for FEMA vaccination sites across the country.

1372293722801586180.text: "To help folks struggling to pay for food and rent, the package makes key investments in food assistance programs like SNAP and WIC, and it provides more than $40 billion in housing assistance to cover rent, mortgage and utility bills." - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

1372293580434378759.text: "For working families, The American Rescue Plan fulfills President Biden’s promise to provide $2,000 in direct assistance to households in need by providing $1,400 checks per person following the $600 down payment from December." - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

1270111545075412994.text:
Specifically, the #JusticeInPolicingAct:

1. Ends qualified immunity
2. Bans abusive practices like chokeholds
3. Creates independent oversight of police misconduct
4. Mandates de-escalation & racial bias training
5. Expands use of body cameras by police officers

1270111541459931136.text:
For too long, apathy & inaction have stood in the way of changing how law enforcement treats black & brown Americans. No more.

The Justice in Policing Act of 2020 will end police brutality, mandate accountability measures & rebuild the trust between officers & their communities.
